website_summaries.verdict: Acer's prime-cut Chromebook Spin 13 is a topped-out 2-in-1 convertible that delivers all-metal ruggedness and unrivaled performance, but at a gourmet price.
pros: Stylus is included and cleverly housed

customer_reviews.title: Superb screen
customer_reviews.text: Exceeded expectation. Left PC's years ago and went Mac. Still like Mac's well enough but they are just way way too expensive these days. This machine does everything (and more) that I need/want and for an awful lot less than Mac prices.
customer_reviews.author: Realist

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for teaching
customer_reviews.text: The stylus is super super useful for teaching my students. This has all the bells and whistles of the best laptops: normal usb, sd card expansion, type c charging, touchscreen, backlit keys, decent trackpad and reasonable battery life. Touchscreen and display is better than all the other chromebooks I've used and even laptops (except maybe like a 4k xps). so it's comfortable to watch things. nonetheless, does take a while getting use to a taller screen, and i think i prefer a shorter one for watching, which would also make it easier to drop on a cluttered desk. battery realistically lasts me half a day i think, but in all fairness i always have it plugged in somewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Bodrul

customer_reviews.title: Great Chromebook
customer_reviews.text: Lovely screen. It is really fast and seems to cope with everything well. Great for browsing, watching films and working in the Cloud etc. It charges very fast, seems well made with a great keyboard. I use it in all modes {tablet, tented etc}. I dropped one star because one of the hinges wasn't straight but seems to operate OK. I did contact Amazon via their customer chat, but waited for so long for a human to help me {you have to go through the robot first} that I gave up. I thought that as the hinge works ok, I will keep the Chromebook as it is probably just cosmetic.
customer_reviews.author: GeeSaun

customer_reviews.title: It's very good!
customer_reviews.text: Not had this product long. We've come from an Asus and a iPad so its a bit different. I do have to say that so far it's everything we want and need. A wee bit of learning to overcome as it's chrome OS but that's not a mountain.
customer_reviews.author: The moose is loose!

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Such a shame right size good weight excellent screen. Just wouldn't run any of the programs I wanted to run. Disgusting that hardly anything off the play store runs on it. Come on Google sort it out. I sent I back in the end.
customer_reviews.author: Neil Duffield

customer_reviews.text: I paid £849 at the end of April, so less than a month ago. Just seeing the same chromebook for £798.99 on the curry website. Should have waited... .

customer_reviews.text: I bought a simular version second hand off Amazon a few weeks ago which is fantastic, as soon as my daughter saw this she wanted one of these instead which i expected, so the other one was returned yesterday. customer_reviews.text: I would so recommend this chromebook I am currently using it for college work but will be happy to use it after I have finished college, I dont think that I'll ever go back to a laptop unless I have to.
